body: Side note: What the fuck kind of high school allows a bunch of teenagers to publish what is essentially guro?

The second story  is generic and typical even for Chiba Toshirou. Which is why I was surprised yet welcoming of the this completely different direction (for him) in the first story.

It's like the first story created specifically as a self parody or to do the exact opposite things he usually does just to see if he could, like he's deconstructing himself. Then he pulls the dream within a dream shtick and its back to the status quo. I swear to god if this becomes a dream within a dream WITHIN ANOTHER DREAM I'm so fucking done.

or maybe I'm thinking to much into a porn plot. I'm having Spec Ops: The Line flashbacks. 

"None of this is real so why do you care?"
The second story is generic as fuck
I get one precious chapter after a cliffhanger and instead of resolving said cliffhanger...  Ugh, why do you gotta toy with my like that ;_;
the first one has more detail in drawings/background and I enjoy fantasy theme, the second is more generic meh :/

What? What the fuck? What a fucking cop out!

That plot twist was just... I am both relieved and annoyed. What is this roller coaster of emotions I've gotten myself on?
